sub_title: Head of Science at International School of The Hague.  Twenty year's experience of teaching IB and MYP chemistry.
summary:
I am Subject Area Leader for Science at the International School of The Hague, having started work there in September 2006.  Prior to that I taught in the International Section of Het Rijnlands Lyceum in Oegstgeest since August 1999.  I have over twenty year’s experience of teaching MYP and DP chemistry, biology, physics and integrated science and an MA in Education from the University of Bath, UK.

Before moving to The Netherlands I lived in Worcester in the United Kingdom, where I obtained a Postgraduate Certificate in Education (PGCE) in Combined Science.  My undergraduate degree is in biochemistry and chemistry, specializing in food technology, from the University of Galați in Romania.  

I live in The Hague in The Netherlands with my husband and children, and enjoy running, cookery, reading and travel.
